When I began posting blogs and videos and updates on the internet, some of you reached out. 

Some of the most precious connections (in some cases, re-connections) in my life have been made in these past months, while we who have been wounded support our fellow wounded sheep on various platforms and forums.

You who care, who love in truth and who love the truth, are gamechangers.

episodes.title: Addressing Leaders in the Lord's Recovery, Specifically at the 2024 Thanksgiving Conference
episodes.description:
This video may or may not be worth your time. I am mainly holding accountable past recipients of emails I sent - almost 4 years ago - seeking help, and those recipients' fellow "co-workers" in "The Lord's Recovery". The abuse I wrote about continues to this day.

In this video message, I address the responsible leaders in the Lord's Recovery ministry, emphasizing the importance of confession and recompense based on Watchman Nee's teachings, since you claim to follow HIM. 

I speak on behalf of many who have suffered the negligence and abuse of leaders in this group, in spite of countless pleas for help, for intervention, for change, for justice, for righteousness, for reconciliation, for oneness.... We offer proof for what you call "baseless accusations," while you blame us for lying, being people of death, being evil, though you specify no scriptural offense for which any of us can repent....

I share some of my personal experiences and challenges faced over the past  recent years, mainly through reading a couple emails and texts previously sent to several of you (who are likely gathered at the Thanksgiving Conference in Atlanta this weekend). To these desperate emails I received minimal to no response from "responsible ones." Most responses from "responsible ones" which I have received to these and other pleas, in my perspective, constitute further abuse. 

Watchman Nee writes in Messages for Building Up New Believers, published by the Living Stream Ministry (bibleread.online/all-books-by-Watchman-Nee-and-Witness-Lee/book-messages-for-building-up-new-believers-vol-2-Watchman-Nee-read-online/22/): 

"In order to live under God’s light, we need a sensitive conscience, and in order for our conscience to remain sensitive, we need to continually condemn sin as sin. We need to confess to God, and we also need to make confessions and recompenses to man....

"If you remember that your brother has something against you, this means you have transgressed against him. Your transgression may or may not be in material things. Perhaps you have offended him by acting unrighteously towards him. The emphasis is not on material things but on that which sets others against you. 

"A new believer should realize that if he offends a person and does not apologize and ask for forgiveness, he is finished as soon as the offended party mentions his name and sighs before God. Whatever he offers to God will not be accepted. Whatever he prays will be turned down. We should not allow any brother or sister to sigh before God because of us. Once he or she sighs, we are finished before God. If we have done something wrong or if we have offended or hurt someone, the offended party need not accuse us before God. All he has to say before God is, “Oh! So-and-so...” or, for that matter, he just needs to utter an “Oh” and whatever we offer to God will be rejected. All he has to do is sigh a little because of us before God. We must not give any brother or sister the reason or the ground to sigh before God because of us. If we give him or her a reason to sigh, we will lose all our spiritual prospects and all our gifts to God will be annulled....

 "If you are offering a gift at the altar and remember that your brother has anything against you or has any reason to sigh because of you, do not offer up your gift. If you want to offer to God, “First go and be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.” God wants the gift, but you must first be reconciled to others. Those who are not reconciled to men will not be able to offer a gift to God.

"Hopefully, the brothers and sisters will be thorough in the matter of confession and recompense. This is the way to maintain their purity. If anyone has transgressed against man, he should confess his sins to God on the one hand, and he must deal with the matter seriously with man on the other hand."

Viewers, especially "responsible ones" in "The Lord's Recovery" are encouraged to reflect on the significance of taking responsibility for your part in the damage of my marriage and family, to consider your part in the all-too-common mistreatment of others (sisters and brothers in Christ, precious enough to be redeemed by His own blood), to confess, and to offer recompense for your wrongdoings, if the Lord shines on you that you had any part in abuse and/or sins that have hurt and/or are still hurting anyone. episodes.description:

After all, we had been "delivered" from "degraded Christianity." We were chosen, called, and faithful. We were, without usually admitting it, an elite group, superior to other Christians. Others were so worldly. We were consecrated and most like the early churches. We were most likely to be overcomers. We were Philadelphia... I believed...

...Until I realized that there wasn't actually, practically the necessary brotherly love in my desperate situation, but rather extreme partiality and heirarchy and rampant abuse and teachings that twisted the Bible to cover sin and abusers

...Until I couldn't bear the use of money to abuse me, and finding a systemic disparity of wealth between the powerful leaders and other privileged and highly regarded members - while the abused whistleblowers like me are marginalized and even desperate needs are completely overlooked.
